title: versioning history
body:
relaying what @schiesbn, @karlitschek and i just discussed about how to handle versioning (this issue supersedes the configuration options #684). some of these thoughts are future visions, not everything needs to be in the first version. @schiesbn is the boss on this.

versioning history should be as automatic as possible. to easily know the limit for both admins and users, versioning should block 50% of the remaining quota, so uploading is still possible.

older versions don’t need to be as granular as very recent ones, so we should have a system similar to what apple’s time machine does, also extending it to the second, minute and hour level:

* every second (or every 2 seconds) for the last 10 seconds
* every 10 seconds for the last minute
* every minute for the last hour
* hourly for the last 24 hours
* daily for the last 30 days
* weekly for all eternity

these are just starting values and we most likely have to adjust them a bit, especially the second values and the % of quota used for versioning.

also it needs to be a bit more intelligent for cases where i have, say, only 3 versions of a file which are a day apart – they should probably both be preserved, just spaced weekly when way back in the past.
to illustrate this, i’d say versions are filling slots: for example every month in the distant past has 4 slots (weekly) which can maximally be filled. if there are only 3 versions of a file (even if only days apart) they should probably use these slots, instead of preserving only one version.

and in general, every file should probably at least have 2 versions. so that when you open a file edited in the past, you never get an empty versions tab.
